sub_title: Travel Blogger | Former Product Marketing Manager - Portable Audio Division at Sony MEA
summary:
Actively looking out for opportunities in NL. Previously, I was employed with Sony Gulf FZE for 6 years, as a Product Marketing Manager for Sony Portable Audio Division. Deep diving into the mind of the customer and competition, the logical reasoning behind one’s buying decision, communicating convincingly and executing with conviction to the consumer to deliver the best brand experience of the marketed product, and finally scaling for upward future growth with an unwavering brand loyalty is a way of working I adopted in my journey as a Product Marketing manager. 

I slowly built on this foundation of marketing by taking the plunge into corporate sales for major IT firms Accenture and Capgemini prior to working at Sony, providing marketing and sales support to many of their energy and utility clients for 4 years. And from there paving my way into a Global MBA specializing in Marketing Management, thus being adept at interpersonal skills, cross-cultural communication and understanding the ways of working of big brands. 

Apart from honing and utilising my marketing skills for the companies I work for; on a personal front, I work pro bono as a Marketing & Advertising consultant for a food services company in Mumbai which kicked off as an entrepreneurial stint. I enjoy travelling, obsessed with meeting new people and have documented my travel experiences, stories and photos from my travel in an online travel journal - www.amysmorningbrew.com. In addition to this, I am a seasoned Bharata Natyam dancer and a newbie in Kathak dancing.

projects.title: 4th Annual Hult Prize Regional Final - Dubai
projects.description:
In partnership with President Clinton and the Clinton Global Initiative, the Hult Prize has created the world’s largest student movement for social impact and the world’s largest crowdsourcing platform, dedicated to solving the most pressing social challenges on the planet. The Hult Prize
is the world’s most acclaimed student initiative for social entrepreneurship.

projects.title: Event Management
projects.description:
Direct involvement in the management of projects including event planning, maintaining quality of work and enthusiasm with people, logistics management, coordination of operational roles within the events teams, communicating and maintaining deadlines and conducting and delivering meetings.

Corporate Events: 
•Entire ownership of the Fresher's Graduation Day event at Accenture – an Entry Level Capability and VAJRA initiative for FY 08 and FY 10
•Accenture Entry Level Capability recognition for excellent contribution to VAJRA initiatives
•Organized and assisted the Fashion Show for Everything Goes! Communications company as a brand promotion for Westside and Men’s Boulevard brands
•Member of the Women’s Council at Capgemini – a Capgemini’s Corporate Responsibility and Sustainability Act
•Organized the North America Sales Transformation Annual event for Mumbai Leadership and sales team – 2011
•PR manager for the Accenture Rock Band ‘Secondary Skills’

MBA School Events: 
•PR and Event coordinator for Spectra 3 - a reverse business case event organized by SP Jain GMBA, Aug 2012
•Culture, Arts & Media Committee Member for SP Jain School of Global Management 
•Conducted the Indian Independence Day 57th Anniversary Event single-handedly for SP Jain School of Global Management
•Choreographer and performed for Flashmob Sentosa - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=owNANqS_Vy0 
•Lead in-house team to manage events, functions and trips for SP Jain – Farewell event, Ferrari World, Abu Dhabi and Universal Studios, Singapore

Other Activities:
•Professional Training in Jazz from ‘The Danceworx Performing Arts Academy’ Academy
•Received accolades in the Inter College dance competition held at VJTI in ‘Pratibimb’-2005, 06 and 07, Dr.D.Y.PATIL in 2007 and RAIT in ‘Horizon’-2006 
•Industry Interface Committee (IICom) Member for SP Jain School of Global Management
•Publication with MBA Skool, Jul 2012 - The need for professional MBA committees

projects.title: Marketing Research Applied Research Project - Pfizer, Singapore
projects.description:
Social Media, an untapped value proposition for the Pharmaceutical Industry in Singapore

•Qualitative research on the untapped value proposition of Social Media for the Singaporean Pharmaceutical Industry from a consumer and industry perspective
•Quantitative and the customer perception study of the usage of social media in creating brand awareness and brand loyalty for the pharma industry
•Consumer Perception & behavior analysis using in-depth interviews and Focus Group Discussions
•Marketing Strategy: Creating brand awareness using Facebook for Pfizer in Singapore

authors.headline: Travel Blogger | Former Product Marketing Manager - Portable Audio Division at Sony MEA

profile_positions.description:
As a travel blogger, I am passionate about exploring new destinations, immersing myself in different cultures, and sharing my experiences with others. Through my blog ‘The Morning Brew’, I aim to inspire and guide fellow travelers by providing detailed itineraries, travel tips, and recommendations for accommodations, restaurants, and attractions.

Whether you are a fellow traveler seeking inspiration, a travel industry professional looking for collaboration opportunities, or simply someone who enjoys reading about different cultures and destinations, I invite you to connect with me on LinkedIn and my website https://www.amysmorningbrew.com.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteered for the Clean Up UAE Campaign, an initiative by the Emirates Environmental Group
volunteer_experiences.description: Clean Up UAE is a grassroots initiative to sweep the nation clean, an initiative that battles against environmental degradation. The campaign not only aims to enhance and protect the landscape through community efforts but also to serve as a platform to raise awareness and strengthen the UAE's commitment towards environmental protection and sustainable living.
